docs.title: Dice Engine
docs.text:
Casino-grade randomness for game mechanics.

Dice Engine provides cryptographically secure random number generation with auditable entropy proofs — never trust a dice roll again.

docs.title: Why Dice Engine?
docs.text:
• CSPRNG Only — No random.random(), ever
  • No Modulo Bias — Rejection sampling for fair rolls
  • Entropy Proofs — Audit any roll after the fact
  • Async-Safe — Thread-safe buffer management

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: uv pip install git+https://github.com/vindicta-platform/Dice-Engine.git

docs.title: Quick Roll
docs.text:
from dice_engine import roll

result = roll("2d6")
print(result.total)       # 7
print(result.proof)       # a1b2c3...

Full Platform

docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/vindicta-platform/Dice-Engine.git
cd Dice-Engine
uv venv && uv pip install -e ".[dev]"

docs.title: What Are They?
docs.text: Every roll produces a cryptographic proof that can verify: - The exact entropy bytes used - The rejection sampling process - The final result derivation

docs.title: Verifying a Roll
docs.text:
from dice_engine import verify_roll

is_valid = verify_roll(result.total, result.proof)

docs.title: Format
docs.text: PROOF: v1|entropy_hex|notation|result|timestamp

docs.title: Why This Matters
docs.text:
• No cheating — Cannot fake rolls
  • Audit trail — Replay any game
  • Trust — Opponents can verify

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: uv pip install git+https://github.com/vindicta-platform/Dice-Engine.git

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
from dice_engine import roll, DiceNotation

# Simple roll
result = roll("2d6")

# With modifier
result = roll("3d6+5")

# Multiple dice types
result = roll("2d6 + 1d8")

docs.title: Notation Format
docs.text: Notation Meaning 2d6 Roll 2 six-sided dice 3d6+5 Roll 3d6, add 5 1d20-2 Roll 1d20, subtract 2
